Workflow.WorkStageName: When registering a product, do you want to copy an existing product?

The function of this screen is to **select a product category** before adding a new product.
① The user **chooses** a product category from the available list.
② After selecting a category, the system **enables the option** to add a product under that category.
③ The user can then proceed with **entering product details** and completing the addition process.
This ensures that each product is correctly classified within the system for **efficient organization and management**.

The function of this screen is to **enter basic product information** and proceed to the next step.
① In **Basic Information Mode**, users **input product details** in the designated fields. ② After completing the input, **press the "Enter" button** to confirm and proceed.
Is there condition information?

The function of this screen is to **inquire about condition groups** in **Condition Information Mode**.
① Press **"Condition Group Inquiry"** to open the **Condition Group Inquiry Popup**. ② In the popup, search for and select the desired **condition group**.
Are there any condition details?

The function of this screen is to **retrieve condition groups and condition codes** based on user input.
① **Enter** or **select** the desired **condition group** and **condition code**.
② **Click** the **"Inquiry"** button to retrieve relevant information.
This screen enables users to efficiently search for and manage condition-related data within the system.

The function of this screen is to **input detailed information and process condition types based on predefined codes**.  

① **Enter the required details** in the provided fields.  
② **Press the "ENTER" button** to proceed.  
③ If the **condition type code** is available in the list, the system will automatically **map the corresponding value** from the common code database.  
④ If the condition type code is **not found**, users can **manually enter the data** or **upload an Excel file** via **Screen 512010**.

The function of this screen is to **map condition information by condition group** and **retrieve detailed condition information**.
① **Map** condition information to the corresponding condition group.
② **Retrieve and display** detailed information for each mapped condition.
Is the condition value type simple?
Is the condition value type a list?
Is there a common code in the condition value type?

The function of this screen is to **input and confirm condition details in Simple Condition Mode**.
① **Enter** the required condition details in the designated fields.
② **Press the ‘Enter’ button** to apply and proceed.

The function of this screen is to **input and manage condition details** in **Simple Condition Mode**.
① **Manually enter** condition details or **upload** them using an **Excel file**.
② Once the details are added, **press the "Enter" button** to confirm and apply the conditions.

The function of this screen is to **input and confirm condition details** in **Simple Condition Mode**.
① **Enter** the required **condition details** in the provided fields.
② **Click the 'Enter' button** to save and proceed.

The function of this screen is to **define and register complex product conditions** in **Complex Condition Mode**.
① In the **"Complex Condition Definition"** pop-up, users **enter product complex conditions** as required.
② Once the conditions are set, users click the **"Confirm"** button to save and apply them.

The function of this screen is to **configure complex condition settings** for data filtering or processing.
① In **Complex Condition Mode**, select the **detailed condition information** from the list.
② Press the **"ENTER"** button to apply the selected condition.

The function of this screen is to **inquire about products subject to modification** in **Basic Condition Mode** or **Inquiry Mode**.
① Users can select between **Basic Condition Mode** and **Inquiry Mode** to filter product information.
② The system retrieves and displays a **list of products** that meet the specified criteria.
③ Users can review the retrieved product details and proceed with further actions as needed.

The function of this screen is to **copy an existing product and modify its details**.
① Click the **'Copy Existing Product'** button.
② The system switches to **Modify Mode**, allowing users to edit the copied product's details.

The function of this screen is to **modify product information** in **Basic Condition Mode**.
① Update the **product information** as needed.
② Press the **'Enter' button** to save the changes.
③ Ensure that the **sales start date** is at least **D+1** (the following day or later) before proceeding—this is a **mandatory requirement**.

The function of this screen is to **inquire about conditions for modification** in **Basic Condition Mode/Inquiry** and register the desired changes.
① **View** the list of detailed conditions applicable for modification.
② **Select** the conditions to be changed.
③ **Press the "Register" button** to confirm and apply the changes.
This screen allows users to efficiently retrieve and update classification criteria based on predefined conditions.
Has the condition application date passed?

The function of this screen is to **finalize the registration process** in **Basic Condition Mode** or **Inquiry Mode**.
① Users can review the entered information before confirming.
② To complete the registration, users must **click the ‘Final Registration Complete’ button**.
③ Once clicked, the system processes the registration and updates the status accordingly.

The function of this screen is to **modify the status code** of a selected condition in **Basic Condition Mode** or **Modify Mode**.
① **Select a condition** from the list.
② **Change the status code** to **'Not Use'**.
③ **Add a new condition code**, if necessary.
This allows users to update the applicable status of a condition efficiently.

The function of this screen is to **assign upper and lower classification codes** and register product classifications.
① **Select** the desired **classification code level** for assignment.
② In **Register Mode**, **click** the appropriate **radio button** to specify the product classification (**Large, Medium, or Small**).

The function of this screen is to **input and classify product information** by specifying a **Product Classification Code** and its **description**.
① **Enter** the appropriate classification code and description for the product.
② **Press** the **"ENTER"** button to confirm and proceed.
Is there Product Classification System Information?

The function of this screen is to **input and register product classification system information**. ① Enter the **Product Classification Code** and **Description** in the designated fields.
② Click the **"ENTER"** button to confirm and save the information.
Do you want to register the **Classification Code Information**?

The function of this screen is to **register classification codes and descriptions** based on a selected product classification system.
① **Search** for the desired **Product Classification Name**.
② **Enter** the corresponding **Classification Code** and **Description**.
③ **Press** the **"ENTER"** button to save the information.
Do you want to register Low Rank Classification Information?

The function of this screen is to **register and manage Low Rank Classification Information**.
① **Enter** the Low Rank Classification **code** and **description**.
② **Press** the **"ENTER" button** to save the information.
This screen operates in **Low Rank Classification Information mode**, allowing users to efficiently input and update classification data.

The function of this screen is to **configure expansion classification** based on a selected basic classification in **Classification Code Information Mode**.
① **Select** the desired **Expansion Classification** under the **Basic Classification** section.
② **Press** the **"Enter"** button to apply the selection.

The function of this screen is to **inquire about product modification history** within the system.
It allows users to:
① **Retrieve and review** past modifications made to financial products.
② **Filter and search** modification records based on specific criteria such as date, product type, or user.
③ **View detailed change logs**, including previous and updated values.
This screen helps ensure **accurate tracking of product changes**, supporting compliance and audit requirements.

The function of this screen is to **retrieve and display a list of products** registered in the system.
① Users can enter search criteria to filter the product list based on specific attributes.
② The system processes the request and returns a list of matching products.
③ Users can review product details, such as name, category, and availability.
This screen helps users efficiently locate and manage product information within the system.
